home.description: The new web-based Visual Novel Engine

home.subTitle: Without writing any code, WebGAL will help you create fully functional visual novels with beautiful UI.

games.webgalGamesInfo: We've picked a few games created using WebGAL

disclaimerInfo.line0: This page is not for downloading games, it is only for collecting games created using WebGAL
disclaimerInfo.line1: Games published by non-WebGAL devs are not related to the WebGAL devs
disclaimerInfo.line2: If a game infringes on your rights, please send an email to

niceUI.title: Elegant UI
niceUI.info: Boost your user experience with our aesthetically pleasing and elegant user interface, enhancing your every interactions.

fullFunction.title: Powerful Functions
fullFunction.info: WebGAL not only supports most of the common features found in mainstream visual novel engines, but also provides custom effects with Pixi.js.

easyToDevelop.title: Easy to develop
easyToDevelop.info: From WebGAL scripting to the visual editor, everything is simple and intuitive.

info.line0: Code once, run everywhere. You can learn the core functions in just 3 minutes, without any prior knowlegde!
info.line1: Ready to bring your fantasies to life? Start creating your own VISUAL NOVEL now!

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.line0: WebGAL and WebGAL Terre are licensed under the MPL-2.0
openSource.line1: Free to use for commercial and non-commercial projects

multiplatform.title: Multi Platform
multiplatform.line0: WebGAL Terre support Windows / macOS / Linux
multiplatform.line1: Export game support Web / Windows / macOS / Linux / android

download.otherDownloadLinkInfo: If the above download address is slow, please try using the following download address

systemRequirements.title: System Requirements
systemRequirements.browser: Browser: Google Chrome / Mozilla Firefox / Microsoft Edge / Other modern browser

firstUse.part0: If you're new to WebGAL, please check out the

readFirst.getHelp: Stuck on a development issue? Check the game development guide first. If you're still stumped, GitHub and the community are here to help!
